oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Newbern Illinois Central Depot: renovation workroom
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: E. Main St. at Jefferson St., Newbern, TN
Black and white photograph of workroom at depot. Room contains stove. Transom window is visible above doorframe. Renovation appears to be in process.

The Illinois Central Depot was built in 1920 for the Illinois Central Railroad to replace the wood frame building that burned in 1918. The depot is exemplary of a "combination depot" in that it contains the passenger shelter, freight house, and business office under one roof. As of 1995, the building had recently undergone restoration to restore it to its 1920 condition using the original architectural drawings as a guide.

transom windows; renovation;
